record.note: Translation by Desjardin de Fontvaine, Electeur de Département de Seine et Oise, who dedicates the work to His Catholic Majesty Joseph Napoléon. The work was intended to give Spain due recognition for discoveries in the New World and to refute the unjust criticisms of rival commercial nations.

record.title: Elizabetha Anglo[rum], id est a intore Angelo[rum] Regina fformosissima & felicissima. Too the disconsolate & retyred spryte, the hermyte of Tybolles. ...: manuscript on vellum, written in a fine professional Chancery hand, elaborated with strapwork flourishes, signed at the end "P. Marbury" and signed on the verso by the Lord Chancellor, Sir Christopher Hatton, with the pendant second Great Seal of Elizabeth (designed and engraved by Nicholas Hilliard)
record.note: This manuscript, a unique specimen of dramatic composition by Queen Elizabeth, represents the only surviving piece of stage property from the Elizabethan theater. It was passed from player to player during the great Theobalds Entertainment of 1591, and it is the only surviving original manuscript of any part of that Entertainment.

Elizabeth was entertained by her Lord High Treasurer, Lord Burghley, at his Hertfordshire house, Theobalds, between 10 and 20 May 1591. In a contemporary manuscript text of the entertainments at Theobalds (British Library, Egerton MS. 2623), there is preserved a fanciful speech by a "Hermit," delivered to the Queen on Burghley's behalf, in which, pleading for royal permission to retire from public life, he requests her to restore to him his "cell," namely, Theobalds. The present document was prepared as an answer to Burghley's request and grants the "Hermit," her "woorthely belooved Coounceloour," the right to retire to his "cave," his "own houus," with "full & pacifik possession of all & every part thearof," and to be henceforth free from public duties if he so wishes.

The text of the "charter" was printed in John Strype's Annals of the Reformation (1709), where it is described as having been "drawn up by the queen herself in a facetious style, to cheer the said treasurer." A highly characteristic example of Elizabethan wit, it has the form of a formal charter, certified and signed by Lord Chancellor Hatton, who is known to have taken part in a number of court entertainments. It bears the Great Seal and was no doubt read out and presented to Burghley, or to an actor representing him as a hermit. Instead of giving a simple answer to Burghley's request to retire from public life, Elizabeth evidently chose to enter into the spirit of the Hermit's request and frame her reply accordingly having this charter drawn up by one of her chancery scribes and passed by Hatton under the Great Seal, as part of a prearranged performance for the amusement of the court on the first day of her visit to Theobalds.

The entertainment at Theobalds are described by E.K. Chambers in The Elizabethan Stage (II:247-248), Sir Walter Greg in the Review of English Studies (I[1924]:452-454), John Payne Collier in his History of English Dramatic Poetry (I:276), Alexander Dyce in The Works of George Peele (III:161-169), and John Nichols in his account of The Progress and Public Processions of Queen Elizabeth (III:74).

Manuscript in English, with caption title "A treatise of urine": 126 p., at end.

record.title: Traité des maladies : formulles des remedis employés dans l'hopital.
record.note: Yale med volume includes two manuscripts written in ink, by different hands, and bound in full leather. It was purchased from Hogg (book seller) in May, 1960.

First item dated Paris le 20 Jan. 1751 on page 176 ; second, in a different hand, is entitled: "Formulles des Remedis Employés dans l'hopital des Religieux de la Charité de Paris" with initials L.S.N.S.J.C. and date 1752.

record.title: Practice of physic / deliver'd by Dr. Gregory, "the Cicero of medical literature".
record.note: Cover title, from manuscript written in black ink and bound with paper covers.
"Copied by James E. DeKay of New York, U.S. of America. Vol. 1st."

record.title: [Medical notes / [signed]: E. A. Daniels, Uxbridge, Nov. 27th, 1875.
record.note: Includes separate index (2 leaves; 21 cm.) inserted at end.

record.title: Diary / written by Ferdinand Cohn in the years 1888-1889.
record.note: Photostat; white on black, with final page dated: Breslau, 1890.
Dr. John Fulton purchased copy from Morris Leikind, September, 1940.

record.title: Notes from Cullen.
record.note: Manuscript, written in brown ink on paper and bound in quarter leather, donated by Dr. John Fulton.

record.title: Mémoire à consulter.
record.note: Manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in cloth, discusses Pierre Desault's 1787 consultations on various medical conditions: including fractures, swelling, retention of urine, epilepsy, hysteria, etc.

record.title: Doctor's accounts : including patients' names, treatments, and fees.
record.note: Manuscript of ink on paper in unbound sheets purchased by Yale Medical Historical Library from Whitlock Farms in Bethany, Connecticut on 8 January 1958. Doctor and location undetermined; but Massachusetts-Connecticut-Rhode Island-New York area seems most likely.
The first part, dated 1775-1783, is 37 x 16 cm; the second part, dated 1789-1792, is 33 x 21 cm.; the third part, dated 1792-1793, is 41 x 16 cm.
The second section is preceded by what looks like 16 pages of student notes.

record.title: Histoire de l'Alchimie / [translated by Koziorwicz].
record.note: Translation of the original German published in Halle, 1832; pencil note on preliminary leaf says 1860.
Manuscript written in black ink on very thin paper and bound in quarter leather with marbled boards; a prior owner was Dr. A. Gabriel Pouchet.

record.title: Account book / of Ezra Dodge, dentist.
record.note: Entries, in ink on paper, dated 1827-1829.
Typed note inserted in book: Dr. Dodge's wife was great-aunt of Mrs. Albert W. Crosby, New Haven, Conn., who presented the account book to the Yale Medical Library, November, 1941.

Signed note from donor, Isabel S. Crosby, dated Nov. 3, 1941 and inserted into book states: "I know Aaron Burr was a patient of Dr. Dodge as I have the round mahogany box in which he kept his artificial teeth."

record.title: Album amicorum of Paulus Haistein von Nuremburg : manuscript.
record.note: There are 15 entries of text within album of chiefly blank leaves.
Binding: brown leather binding, P.H.N. 1625 embossed in gold on cover. Traces of clasps.
Decoration: colored coat of arms of Paulus Haistein on 7r. Label with colored scene depicting Orpheus surrounded by animals inside the manuscript.

record.title: A course of lectures on physiology / by Dr. Haighton, 1814-1815.
record.note: Manuscript, written in black ink into two volumes bound in full leather, was donated to Yale Med by Dr. John Fulton.

record.title: Considerations uppon Mr. Hookes' attempt for ye explication of ye exp[erimen]t of waters ascent into small glasse canes : obse[rvations] from his micrographia : manuscript.
record.note: Text is sparsely decorated with manuscript drawings of Hooke's experiments.
Binding: gold-tooled red leather binding. The binding is too large for the text block indicating that it was not original to this manuscript.
The manuscript is foliated on the reverse of each page.

record.title: The solar system : or the astronomy of the planets : the arrangement of the planets that have been supposed.
record.note: First leaf signed: Chas. Bonar, Perth Academy, 1788.
Manuscript, written in black ink on paper and bound in contemporary quarter leather with marbled boards, acquired by John Fulton from Murray's at Edinburgh August 12, 1922.

record.title: Certificate granting the title of Viceprotomedicus : manuscript.
record.note: Signed by Cardinal Altieri (with his seal), Franc. Antaldus and De Angelis (?).
Gold frame around the text. Opening and names gilded.

record.title: Generelle und specielle Materia Medica / vorgetragen vom Professor Herr Dr. Osann, in Sommersemester 1822.
record.note: Manuscript, written in black ink on paper and bound in quarter leather, was purchased by Yale Med from Argosy Bookstore in March, 1964; it has pages hand-numbered by the author ( presumably an unnamed medical student taking Dr. Osann's Materia medica class at Berlin) and includes his neatly written index.

record.title: Catalogue of the Yale Medical College Library : New Haven - Feb. 25th, 1865 / C. S. K.
record.note: Manuscript, written in ink on lined paper, was transferred to Med Hist in December, 1959.

record.title: Statuta Collegii Medicorum London and other texts : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript, in unidentified hand, on paper containing excerpts copied from the Latin statutes of the Royal College of Physicians of 1523 (the fourteenth year of Henry 8's reign). Subjects include examinations, admissions, oath-swearing, etc. Also includes an English text proposing the founding of a new public school erected in the place of the present grammar school of St. Andrews and discussing the advantages of the mathematical sciences in the context of school education. It is followed by a Latin theological treatise (with quotes in Greek from, e.g., Chrysostom). An anonymous English letter to the king, addressing the nature of a certain faction in parliament, closes the manuscript.

Full title from caption: Statuta Collegii Medicorum London quibus praemittuntur litera patentis concissa communitate sive Collegio medicorum London ab Henrico 8 Rege Anglia, extracta e statuto anno regni sui xiiiio Cap. 5 edito.

record.title: Opusculum in quo tractatus de pulsibus ac morborum prenotionibus continentur : manuscript.
record.note: Author listed, but erased at the bottom of title page: auctore Vt. Be. M. - P. H. [or K].
Binding: black leather binding. Edges gilt. Metal clasps attaching to the back cover.

record.title: A system concerning fevers : their severall symptoms that accompany them, with the methode of their severall cures : manuscript.
record.note: Title from title page. Full title page: A system concerning fevers, their severall symptoms that accompany them, with the methode of their severall cures, as also of severall other matters necessary by all to be known in order to their cure / collected out of the best modern authours both forrainge and domestick / transcribed and translated in the year of our Lord 1677.
Binding: bound in gold-tooled black leather with metal clasps.
Layout: main text in the center, short descriptions of the text in the margins, titles of individual sections at the top of the page. Contemporary pagination on outer corner of the page.

record.title: De insitione variolarum : [method of surgeon Winchester of London].
record.note: Text appears on pages 1-11 and 26-28; remaining pages blank.

Manuscript, ink on paper, is Camper's unsigned notes taken on his first trip to London during March and April, 1749. Dr. Klebs acquired from Amsterdam (letter enclosed with document) in 1934 and donated to the Yale Medical Historical Library.

record.title: A rheume pill which is good for the recovery of ye coughe of ye lungs or in any kind of consumtion or rheume : and other remedies : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger, largely transcribed from first heading.

record.title: Ovid's Metamorphosis : manuscript.
record.note: Also includes a print image before the text, of: Sr. Samuel Garth, M. D. Published by G. Kearsly, No.46, Fleet Street.
Binding: bound by Wallis in gold-tooled red morocco. Gilt edges. Gold-tooled on spine: Garth. Ovid's metamorphosis. The original holograph manuscript. Back cover loose.
This work was published in 1717, used here as date ante quem.

record.title: Appearances of Mr. Wolffs solutions.
record.note: The seven leaves at end have title: A list of saline preparations made by Peter Woulfe for the Right Honorable The Earl of Bute.
Manuscript (originally owned by John Stuart Bute), written in ink on paper and bound in contemporary boards, was purchased by Dr. John Fulton from the Bookshop of Douglas Cleverdon in October, 1937.

record.title: Recipe book containing over 150 medicinal receipts : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: brown leather binding over pasteboard. Title on spine: Receipts.

record.title: Histoire des maladies de la tête et de la poictrine : manuscript / par Mr. Chyrac.
record.note: Title from titlepage. Date information also from titlepage.
Bound in brown leather binding over pasteboard. Spine label with title: MS. D. Chejrac. Histoire Des Maladies 1693. Edges sprinkled in red ink.

record.title: Praxeos medicae.
record.note: Manuscript, written in black ink on paper and bound in contemporary vellum, was purchased by Yale Med from Thiebaud (Paris book dealer) catalog 81 in May, 1961; dealer states they're unable to determine origin.

record.title: Journals of his continental tour, 1775-1776 : selections.
record.note: Manuscript, written in black ink and bound in contemporary paper, was donated to Yale Med by John Fulton.

record.title: Théorie mécanique de la perception de la pensée et la réaction.
record.note: Manuscript, written in ink on white unlined paper and bound in quarter leather, includes drawings by the author.
Verso of leaf 47 is signed and dated: Charles Cros 12 Mars 1885.

record.title: Examen chimico-légal de diverses substances alimentaires, avant occasionné des accidents : séance du 11 avril 1851 / par MM. Morin et J. Girardin.
record.note: Published in "Précis d. trav. Acad. de Rouen, 1850-51": cf. Surgeon General's Catalog 2nd series, vol. XI, page 88.

Manuscript, written in ink on loose sheets of paper, is a chemico-legal essay on certain alimentary substances which have been the cause of accidents; dealing with a case of poisoning from bad bread. It was purchased by Yale Med in 1958.

record.title: [Scientific correspondence : eight handwritten letters, signed: J. Priestley ; with a handwritten copy by Jean André de Luc of a paper read by Dr. Priestley at the Royal Society in 1791].
record.note: Letters, each written in brown ink on one folded leaf of paper, were acquired by Dr. John Fulton for Yale Med ca. 1939. Individual letters dated: 1776, 1780, 1782, 1782, 1783, 1784, 1785, and 1791. Luc's notes dated 1791.

record.title: Medical prescription book kept on board U.S. Frigate Constitution : August 28, 1812-March 5, 1813.
record.note: Log book of Dr. Amos Evans, surgeon on board the U.S.S. Constitution (August 28,1812-March 5, 1813).

record.title: Outline of the history of medicine.
Opera Pauli Barbette chirurgica : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: bound in dark brown blind-tooled leather binding. Re-backed. Spine label: Barbette 17th c. MS.
Table of contents at the beginning.

record.title: ["Commonplace book" of weights and measures : used by either a merchant or a U.S. Customs representative].
record.note: Manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in cloth, includes entries dated 1823-1851, in no particular order.

record.title: Hamilton Aïdé papers, 1824-1906.
record.note: Letters to Fullerton from Aïdé, and to Aïdé from Fullerton are in the Morton Fullerton Papers.

record.title: Alberti cognomento Magni De secretis mulierum libellus scholis avitus et a mendis repurgatus : Eiusdem De virtutibus herbarum, lapidum, et animalium quorundam libellus. Item De mirabilibus mundi, ac de quibusdam affectibus causatis a quibusdam animalibus, manuscript.
record.note: The third text, written in Italian, has a separate title: "Delle gemme che produce la natura della qualità, grandezza, bellezza, e virtù loro."
Bound in vellum over pasteboards. Note on the spine: Alberti magni.
Two separate series of foliation. Second series starts at the beginning of the third text.

record.title: Collection of medical receipts.
record.note: Script: humanist minuscule and gothic textualis.
Decoration: rubricated headings and rubrication throughout.

Incipit text 1: Tolle una melagrana et mondala tucta et poi la pesta et trane el sugho... Heading text 2: El consiglio di Mastro Tomasso da Garbo contro la pestilentia. Incipit text 3: Verdolaghe. La verdolaga e de amorosa natura et de freda perche siando pistata et metuta sopra lo ventre tira la febre...

record.title: Student notes on medicine.
record.note: Binding: blind-tooled white leather over blind-tooled vellum three-quarter binding. Vellum is painted green over unidentified manuscript materials (with sparse rubrication). Gilt-stamped, but tarnished initials (I.M.D.) on front cover.

record.title: Miscellaneous medical manuscript.
record.note: Layout: single column of varying length. Some notes are made in double columns.
Binding: Contemporary blind-tooled brown leather. Includes traces of leather straps and metal clasps.

record.title: Collection of prescriptions against the plague and other diseases.
record.note: Manuscript, in various hands, on paper, containing a set of presprinctions against the plague and other diseases. The manuscript is signed by various physicians of Southern Germany including originals and copies, for instance from Michael Schrick, and dated from 1475-1535. Includes: Many different treatises on the plague, prescriptions for bloodletting (Latin and German), plasters against diseases of the legs, Ars memorativa, a treatise on spirits, prescription against dysentery, prescription against stone disease.
Binding: brown blind-tooled leather binding. Traces of metal clasps.

record.title: De somniis.
Collection of recipes for cures.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger. Title page is damaged with loss of text.
Dated to February 18 1598 on the final page.
Includes author's hand-written index at beginning of work.
Layout: single column of varying length.
Binding: bound in vellum, blind-tooled with geometric designs.

record.title: Methodus generalis et compendiaria, ex Hippocratis, Galeni, et Avicennae placitis deprompta, ac in ordinem redacta.
Ein neuw künnstliches Kochbuech von etligenn fürnnemen Köchen zusamenn getragenn ...
record.note: Layout: single column of between 20 and 25 lines; single column of around 20 lines; single column of around 15 lines.
Binding: contemporary blind-tooled brown leather binding glued on top of a modern dark brown leather binding.
Foliation: 182, 55 unnumbered leaves, 53. Corresponds to the three different hands of the main text.
Dated on title page: Anno salutis 1571.

record.title: Die Kunst, Cÿrurgia : manuscript.
record.note: Chapter headings indicated in red ink; also includes a short sentence on the content of the next chapter.
Binding: modern brown artificial leather half binding. Gold-tooled title on the spine: Die Kunst Cyrurgia.

record.title: De trinitatis erroribus libri VII : manuscript / per Michaelem Servetum alias Reves ab Aragonia hispanum.
record.note: Binding: vellum half-binding over brown leather. Edges in blue ink.
Marginal notes in another hand providing corrections and brief explanations to the text.

record.title: Ross Ertzney auss vielen Kunstbuchern von allerlei frembden und deutschen Sprachen, zu dem auch von vielen erfarnen Hueffschmieden zuweg und in gewisse Ordnung gebracht und aus dem Druckh von neuem beschriben worden im 1591.
record.note: Binding: blind-tooled brown leather binding. Red sprinkled edges. Label on spine: Ros Artzney.
Heavily trimmed on the top and fore edge with loss of text.

record.title: Laparotomy / H. M. Clapp.
record.note: Manuscript in ink; dated from author's statement on leaf [5] that he lists all the laparotomies "reported for the year 1888."

Author not a Yale Medical School graduate; he practised in Stratford, Conn. starting in 1890, having graduated earlier that year from the University of Vermont College of Medicine (Burlington, Vermont).

record.title: A commendatory oration made in the publick hall of the Royal Colledge of Physicians at London, the 17th day of September 1697 : manuscript / by Sam Garth, Fellow of the said colledge.
record.note: Title from heading. Additional title on verso of the final leaf: 16 September 1697, Sir Samuel Garth, Oration in the publick Hall of the Royal Colledge of Physicians at London.

record.title: Tractatus de morbis virginum ; Tractatus in librum Galeni de usu partium : manuscript.
record.note: Final 197 pages contain the "Tractatus in librum Galeni."
Binding: vellum over pasteboards. Spine title in black ink: Tractatus de morbis virginu[m].

record.title: Key to Garth's dispensary : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: green leather binding. Gold tooled spine title: Garth - MS. Key to Dispensary.

record.title: Institutiones et dissertationes medicinales : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: marbled vellum binding over pasteboards. Spine labels: Disserta medicar / Manuscr; Institutione medicae / manuscriptum.

record.title: The problem of flight and other treatises : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger on the basis of accompanying documentation.
This original manuscript is quoted in Duhem: Histoire des idees aeronautiques avant Montgolfier, Paris, 1943.
Lunar tables, drawn in pen, are found on pages 140-147.
Binding: light-brown gold-tooled leather binding (with coat of arms of Guyot de Vaudray in the center of the front and back covers).

record.title: Formule des remedes suivant le sentiment & la pratique de Mr. Barbeyrac, tres fameux medecin de Montpelier : manuscript.
record.note: Bound in vellum over pasteboard. Title on spine: Barbeyrac Formules de remedes. XVIIe. s.

record.title: Breve trattato da anatomia ; Della osteologia : manuscript.
record.note: Title from headings on ff. 1r and 75r.

record.title: Chirurgiae facultatis tractationes : manuscript.
record.note: Title from colophon at the end of the volume.
Colophon at end of volume: Ad Dei Beataeq[ue] Virginis laudem et finem imposui in capitulo Divi Dom[ini]ci anno D[omi]ni MDCXXXII die vero III Idibus Martii.
Bound in vellum over pasteboard. Red ink applied on all edges. Manuscript note on spine: Chirurgiae 1632.

record.title: Praxeos medicae : manuscript.
record.note: Pagination, in a different hand, of the main part of the text.
Binding: dark brown leather binding with gold-tooled spine.
Many pages at the end are left blank.

record.title: Enchiridium, or an abridgment of Platerus Golden practise of physick by T. W., : containing the most proper cures of all kinds of sunry diseases incident to the body of man or woman : manuscript / by Felix Plater [...] Abdiah Cole [and] Nick Culpepper [...]
record.note: Full statement of responsibility: By Felic Plater, chief phisitian [and] professor in ordinary at Basill, Abdiah Cole, Dr of phisick [and] the liberall arts, Nick Culpepper Gent., student in phisick [and] astrology.
The initials T. W., who is said to be responsible for this text, are sometimes identified as Thomas Willis.
Index present at the end of the volume.

record.title: Traité de matière médicale : manuscript.
record.note: Title from front titlepage. Part 2 has second titlepage: Formules de M. Chirac.
Bound in brown leather binding over pasteboard. Spine is gold-tooled and includes red tag with title: Matiere Medicale. Sprinkled edges.
Loose specimen of a leaf located between final page and back cover.

record.title: Particularis methodus medendi : manuscript.
record.note: Title from heading on first page.
Binding: vellum half-binding over marbled paper.

record.title: Medicina diastica in tractatum tertium de tempore seu philosophia D. Theophrasti Paracelsi, Jena, 1629 : manuscript.
record.note: Many pages at the end of the volume are left blank.

record.title: Document signed by Queen Henrietta Maria's Council, including Sir Kenelm Digby, George Digby, second earl of Bristol and others : manuscript.
record.note: Written and signed at the Queen's Council Chamber, in Denmark House.

record.title: Einer löblichen Landschafft dess Ertzherzogts. Österr. ... Bericht auf die Frag: was es mit der alhie eingerissenen Seüch für ain Beschaffenhait habe.
record.note: Signed by Philip Persius, Johann Springer, and Johann Peryllus.

record.title: Statuts du Collège des Médecins de la République de Venise : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: paper quarter binding. Label on spine: Rubrice statutor et ordinum Collegii D.D. Phisicor Alme Civitis Venetis. 1550-1627. Two titles on cover (in two different hands): Medici; Statuts du Collège des Médecins de la République de Venise. Manuscrit du XVIIIe siècle.

record.title: Catalogus librorum d[omi]ni Jacobi Sarraceni : manuscript.
record.note: Housed in a brown cloth case. On cover: Catalogue Sarrazin Medical Library 1639.
The first 12 leaves are dated to April 10, 1639; the next 10 leaves are dated to April 4, 1639.
The first 12 leaves are in folio while the following 10 leaves are a smaller folio, measuring 31 x 20.5 cm.

record.title: Taʻrīfāt. -- 1559.
record.note: Marginalia. 5 pages of notes precede text.

record.title: al-Risālah al-wāsiṭah bayna al-mursil wa-al-mursal ilayhi fī īṣāl al-akhbār wa-al-aḥkām. -- [18--?].
[Sharḥ al-basmalah]. -- [18--?].
record.note: Preceded by 3 pages of notes and 2 blank pages.

record.title: [Rīsālah fī al-ḥamdalah]. -- 1752 or 3.
[Risālah fī bayān lafẓ Kitāb al-ṭahārah]. -- 1611.
Risālah fī al-muʾannath al-samāʻīyah ʻalá tartīb ḥurūf. -- [16--?].
record.note: Followed by several pages in various hands on terms, etc.

record.title: Faṣl fī al-salām. -- [17--?].
Tuḥfah-i Shāhidī. -- 1752 or 3.
[Masāʾil tataʻallaqa bi-al-ziyādah ʻalá radd al-Salām]. -- [16--?].
record.note: Mach gives title as: Risālah fī qawl al-ʻawām baʻd al-Salām bi-al-Turkiyah Sabahin khayr olsūn, by al-Güzelḥisārī.

record.title: ʻUjalah mukhṭaṣarah fī mafhūm al-ʻIzzī. -- 1791.
Bānat Suʻād. -- [ca. 1561?].
[Kitāb ʻumdat al-muftī ʻalá madhhab al-imām al-aʻẓam Abī Ḥanīfah]. -- [17--?].
record.note: Hitti gives title as: al-Farāwī al-ṣughrá.

record.title: Risālat ṭabaqāt al-mujhidīn ʻan rasāʼil Kamāl Pāshā Zadah. -- [17--?].
record.note: Brockelmann gives title as: Risālah fī ṭabaqāt al-fuqahāʼ.

record.title: Risālah fī irtifāʻ. -- [17--].
[Risālah fī al-asṭurlāb]. -- [17--].
Risale-yi asṭurlāb. -- [17--].
Risale-yi ceyb āfakī. -- [17--].
record.note: Variant title in manuscript: Risale-yi ceyb turkī.

record.title: Risale-yi rubʾu daire-yi muḳanterat. -- [17--].
Sharḥ Badʾ al-amālī. -- [16--].
record.note: Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: [Notes on reading the Qurʾān]. -- [ca. 1704].
record.note: Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: [Commentary on religious duties]. -- [16-- or 17--].
record.note: Author and title have not been identified.
Islamic binding, in brown, with flap.

record.title: Romanov collection, 1894-1935 (bulk 1907-1918).
record.note: Photograph albums are numbered 2 through 7; album 1 is not in the collection.

Selected photographs from the photograph albums are reproduced in: The Romanov family album / picture research and description by Marilyn Pfeifer Swezey; assembled by Anna Vyrubova. New York: Vendome Press, 1982.

record.title: [On prayer and belief in God]. -- [17--].
[Treatise]. -- [16--?].
record.note: Islamic binding, covered in blue fabric, with flap.

record.title: Risālah fī ajzāʾ al-qaḍīyah. -- 1841.
[Risālah fī ithbāt al-sunnah al-khabarīyah]. -- [17--].
[Risālah fī ādāb al-munāẓarah]. -- [18--].
Masʾalat ālʾān fī ʻilm wujūh ṭuruq al-Qurʾān. -- 1691.
record.note: Islamic binding, covered in red fabric, with flap.

record.title: [Posture], 1977.
record.note: Includes bibliographical references (8 leaves at end).

record.title: [Album of centenarians / by the late Dr. H. B. Ferris].
record.note: Photographs set into album with red velvet covers and decorative metal clasps.

Collection of portraits on the general subject of the physical aspects of senescence or longevity; album donated to Yale Med in September, 1943 by Dr. Ferris's daughter and son [Helen Ferris Hooker (Mrs. Davenport Hooker) and Dr. Henry Whiting Ferris, respectively].

record.title: [Doctor's book of prescriptions : symptoms and treatments, including for farm animals].
record.note: Manuscript, written in purple or black ink, or pencil, on lined paper, is bound in full leather. First 81 pages are numbered; remainder, in seemingly various hands, includes blank sheets. Latter portions dated 1886-1899 based upon material in text; the first 81 pages likely to be earlier.
Includes separate indices inside front and back covers.

record.title: List of the Procuratori di San Marco : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: vellum binding over pasteboards. Former catalog number (?) "93" on front cover. Former manuscript title in pencil on front cover: Procurati di S. Marco, 1312-1699.
Incipit: Nel anno del salvatore nostro Jesu Cristo mcccxii adi xiv. ducanti il ser[enissi]mo domino Anzolo [.ado..] nel magior consegio fu meso una parte de elego nei procuratori di S. Marco ...

record.title: [Membership list by year], ca. 1905.
record.note: Cover title: Williard Burr Soper/ D. 102. On back cover: 322.

record.title: [Autograph book / owned by Peter Beardslee].
record.note: Author listed as Peter Beardsley in Yale Medical class of 1848; he attended Yale 1845-1846.

Manuscript, written in brown or black ink on white paper and bound in full cloth, includes engraved portraits and blank leaves; it was purchased by Yale Med in November, 1960 from Robbie's [bookseller, New Haven, Conn.?].

Contains autographs of Jeremiah Day, Benjamin Silliman, Eli Ives, Jonathan Knight, Timothy P. Beers, Charles Hooker, Henry Bronson [et al.]. Beardslee left Yale Med in 1846 and attended Geneva Medical College in 1847.

record.title: Institutiones physiologicae, IV volum: complexae.
record.note: Latin manuscript bound in two volumes (quarter calf), with an engraved portrait tipped into Volume 1.

record.title: Barber-surgeon apprentice letter.
record.note: Also includes a well-preserved wax seal of Matthäus Schöff of the Landsberg School, the witness, with his arms.

record.title: Suculenta reru[m] medicaru[m] congeries : manuscript.
record.note: Colophon: Commentariolor. Sive, Enchirid. medic. et patinic. consilij ad medicina' studiosos.
Text's authorship is ascribed to Guy Patin. Manuscript note on the title page, in a different hand: authore Guidone Patino.
Binding: brown leather binding. Gold-tooled label with spine title: codex medic. Number in black ink on back cover: 1315? Edges painted with red ink.

record.title: Second mémoire sur les inconvéniens et les dangers qu'entrainent les exhumations des cadavres destinés aux anatomistes ; manuscript written in ink in a contemporary hand.
record.note: Pages 69-88 form Troisième mémoire sur les moyens d'eviter les maux que causent les exhumations, & d'accroitre les progrès de l'anatomie.

record.title: Signs of diseases : manuscript / by James Stone, Sydney College, Cambridge, 1671.
record.note: Manuscript (incomplete), on paper, in unidentified hand, containing James Stone's Signs of diseases. The text is a list of possible diseases along with a multitude of symptoms. Also contains a list of local records from 1764, including notices of death, marriage, birth, etc, and a short note from a text called State of liberty(?).
Paginated 227-250, indicating this text was removed from its original manuscript.

record.title: Folheto sobre a encoculaçao da vacina, ca. 1809.
record.note: 8 leaves have text, one is a color plate, and two are blank.
Manuscript, written in dark ink on light blue paper, was purchased by Yale Med from Gurney (book dealer?) in October, 1963.
An unpublished tract on vaccination, by the surgeon to a cavalry regiment from Minas Geraes. It was intended to be published, has a dedication to the Count of Palma, and is divided into chapters.

record.title: [Cookbook belonging to Sarah and Elizabeth Tully : the two surviving daughters of William Tully (1785-1859)].
record.note: Manuscript, written chiefly in pencil into a bound, leather volume onto lined paper, was donated to Yale in October, 1962 by Helen Ferris (Mrs. Davenport) Hooker. Earliest dated piece is 1846; material added up to ca. 1899. About a third of the pages have writing, remainder is blank; some cut-outs of recipes, etc. are inserted.

record.title: Office account book of P.A. Jewett and T.B. Townsend.
record.note: At the end is a brief account of the association of Townsend and Jewett.
Includes patient information concerning the practice in New Haven, Conn.

record.title: Private accounts of T.B. Townsend.
record.note: Includes patient information concerning practice in New Haven, Conn.

record.title: Physiology / von Geh. Hofrath Tiedemann [a student's notes on Tiedemann's course at Heidelberg, about 1830].
record.note: Manuscript, written in black ink on paper and bound in contemporary cloth boards, was purchased by Yale Med from Zeitlin catalog 182 in May, 1958; approximate date taken from dealer's descriptive paragraph.

Final group of pagings has half title: "Zweiter Abschnitt von der Bildungsgeschichte des Foetus." Its page 105 has half title: "Dritter Abschnitt Von den Abweichungen in der Bildung des Eyes im Foetus." Tiedemann was professor of anatomy and physiology at Heidelberg from 1816.

record.title: Ziektekundige ontleedkunde : tweede gedeelte ; over de verkregene gebreken (vitia acquivita) geschreven door ... med. stud. Amsterdam 1835-1836 / W. Vrolik.
record.note: Manuscript, neatly written in ink into bound quarter leather book, was donated to Yale Med by Dr. John Fulton.

record.title: Account book, 1857 September 15-1868 June 10.
record.note: Palmer's dates, April 15, 1803-May 8, 1868, from Holloway, L. Medical Obituaries: New York and London, 1981, page 345a.

Manuscript, written in brown ink into notebook bound in full leather, was taken from Yale's faculty archives in June, 1963; a pencil note says that there is no evidence Dr. Palmer had a Yale connection.

record.title: Lectures on physiology by Professor Sharpey, 1837-38 / Richard Quain University College London, 1837-1838.
record.note: Manuscript written in black ink on paper and bound into two quarter leather volumes with marbled boards.

record.title: La chirurgie de Jamerius d'apres les fragments de l'ouvrage de Guy de Chauliac / A. Saland ; these de Berlin, 1895.
record.note: Translation, in the hand of Édouard Nicaise, of the first 13 pages and the résumé of the original edition.
Author's name from NUC, as on his 1895 Berlin dissertation, in which this manuscript material was used.

record.title: Surgeon's log.
record.note: Main title page has "S.S. St. Patrick" crossed out, and "S. S. Canadian" written in.
Note on title page: "This log to be regularly written up, and to be returned to Office of Jas and Alex Allan 70 Great Clyde St. Glasgow at end of each voyage."
Added title page: "Medical Journal of S.S. 'St. Patrick'".
Verso of page 93: "Season 1873, James Graham, surgeon." 1874-1875 sections at end variously signed: John Dickson, Robert W. Wilson, and John M. Adam. None of pages 1-93 were signed.
Manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in cloth, was purchased by Yale Med in June, 1962 from book dealer Laurie Hill.

record.title: Nerves / notes by a un-named medical student, probably from a class taught by a Professor Wallace (named on page [144]).
record.note: Manuscript, neatly written in ink on un-lined paper into a small, leather-bound notebook, includes notes on the nervous system.

record.title: Sincera opinione del P. M[...]ro F. Paolo fù consultore di Stato ... : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: bound in vellum over pasteboard.

Title and date from opening statement: Sincera opinione del P. M[aest]ro S. Paolo fù consultore di Stato alli Sig[...] Inq[...]i di Stato, in qual modo si debba regolare la Rep[...]ca Ven[...]a internamente ed esternamente per aver perpetuo dominio ... commissione l'anno 1612.

record.title: "Eduardus Fawdeary, his book, 1700."
record.note: Includes various authors and subjects: art, colors, medicine (pages 1-173), etc.; and notes by James Bradshaw (written back to front and upside down on pages 196-207) concerning his 1746 execution.
Page 187 states that William Bradbury was born on 14 June 1713 and married Mary Gilbert on 27 September 1741 at Cripplegate Church,
Three leaves (dated 5 3 1949) enclosed, with heading: "Translation of cabalistic writing on the title page and on pp. 162-166."

record.title: Historia dell' Inquisitione : e particolarm[ente] della Veneta, co' i motivi per i quali la ser[enissima] Rep[ublica] di Venetia fece già diverse ordinationi intorno à tal materia : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: gold-tooled vellum over pasteboards. Spine title: Hist dell inquisit.
Dedicated to the Doge of Venice (unidentified further): Al serenissimo Doge di Venetia F.P.U.S. felicità desidera
Table of contents with short descriptions of the separate chapters at the beginning of the volume.

record.title: Ophthalmoscopic sketches, commenced at Fort Pitt [Penn.?], 1861 : greatest number of sketches and notes done by M. A. Striedinger; latest drawings by T. Longmore [et al.], 1861-1866.
record.note: Manuscript, chiefly color illustrations with notes in pencil and ink and bound in leather, was purchased by Yale Med from Harper (bookseller?) in October, 1959. Some leaves are blank, and some plates have notes on verso. Notation inside front cover says Dr. Longmore transferred this book to Dr. Whitehead in 1893.

record.title: De febribus : manuscript.
[Miscellaneous handwritten papers : chiefly concerning aeronautics, and dated 1838].
record.note: Ten pieces in various pagings, written in ink on white paper, are signed on final leaf: Muzio Muzzi, and dated 18 D'bre 1838.
The 11th paper (16 p. within color wrappers) is in verse, and signed: Crescio Congruo.

record.title: Account book, 1849 October 14 -1856 December 13.
record.note: Palmer's dates, April 15, 1803-May 8, 1868, from Holloway, L. Medical Obituaries: New York and London, 1981, page 345a.

Manuscript notebook, written in ink and bound in quarter leather with cloth boards, contains record of accounts of Dr. Palmer, Stonington, Conn. Yale Med accessioned item from its Archives in January, 1956.

record.title: Notes taken at the College of Physicians and Surgeons of the Western District, Fairfield, Herkimer County, New York, October 3d, 1826-27.
record.note: Manuscript, written in brown ink into notebook bound in quarter leather, was donated to Yale Med in October, 1973.
Some leaves and botanical drawings included in blank pages following the numbered pages.

record.title: Recueil de recette : pour meaux (sic) et maladies, [1818].
record.note: Manuscript, written in black ink on lined paper and bound in full cloth, was purchased by Yale Med from Thiebaud catalog 85 in 1963; the 27 p. at end comprise an index to the 839 recipes.

record.title: Les sensations et les perceptions / par M. Ribot 1888-90.
record.note: Manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in quarter leather with marbled end papers, was purchased by Yale Med from Thiebaud (Paris book dealer) catalog 85 in 1963.
Lecture notes taken by a student in Paris.

record.title: Experiments on digestion / by Charles Henry Schultz ; translated from the Latin original by G. Henry Lodge, M.D., 1839.
record.note: Manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in full cloth, includes hand lettered title page.

record.title: [Anatomy notebook : with 18 drawings].
record.note: Manuscript, written in black ink on paper and bound in contemporary quarter leather with marbled boards, was purchased by Yale Med from L. H. Butterfield (of Cambridge, Mass.) in January, 1963; no data available about place or date of production, but dealer states it came with papers of Prof. Francis Noyes Balch.

record.title: Letter book. New Haven, Conn.: Sept. 3,1886 - July 4,1891.
record.note: Contains copies of Dr. Anderson's correspondence, much of which refers to his duties as Medical Examiner, State of Connecticut.
Hardcover notebook; letters written in black ink on tissue sheets.

record.title: Spezielle Pathologie und Therapie / von Dr. Balser ; II. die Entzündungen.
record.note: Manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in contemporary boards, acquired by Yale Med from the estate of Dr. Bruno Kisch in January, 1968. Author's full name not given; but likely Dr. Georg Balser, of Giessen.

record.title: Bartram's apothecary notes.
record.note: Inscription written inside front cover reads: George W. Bartram, druggist chemist & apothecary, Philadelphia, 1811.

Manuscript, written in black ink on paper and bound in full leather, a gift in 1954 from the estate of Stanley Griswold Flagg (died 1953), who attended Yale's Sheffield Scientific School 1904-1906 as a member of the class of 1907-S.
Notebook of 215 numbered prescriptions, medical and domestic; followed by a series of blank leaves, with one containing a pencil notation dated 1848.

record.title: Pathology : Winter 1892/93 / Dr. Bergtold ; Wm. Gaertner.
record.note: Lecture notes, written in ink on paper and bound in quarter leather, were taken by William Gaertner. Included are commentary and hand-colored drawings.

record.title: Description du voile du palais et fonctions de cet organ.
record.note: Manuscript, written in brown ink on folded paper, acquired by Yale Med. from F. Thomas Heller (bookseller, New York) in July 1956. It is reputed to be in Bernard's hand.
Includes paperwork related to purchase; in acid free envelope: 30 cm.

record.title: Notes on Doctor Bigelow's lectures on materia medica / taken by Robert T. P. Fiske [at Harvard Medical School, likely in 1819].
record.note: Manuscript, written in ink on lined paper in notebook and bound in cloth and quarter leather, was purchased for the Yale Medical Library in August, 1957.
An index of 6 pages, preceded by 30 blank pages, is included at end.

record.title: Cahier de chirurgie / par J. Boyveau ; le 8 avril 1815.
record.note: Manuscript, written in ink on paper and bound in full cloth, was purchased by Yale Med from Nourry-Thiebaud catalog 80 in October, 1960. Likely written by a student of an un-named Paris professor of surgery, it is composed of lecture notes containing a short history of surgery and its application in different diseases, which are divided into six categories.
Page 101 is omitted in the author's hand numbering; it is entered as 102.
